title: View of dock symbols in fog shows all symbols superimposed

content.raw:
When adding fog to the scene, the dock symbols have a ghosting artifact evident .

How to reproduce:

1. In default branch run  `roslaunch vrx_gazebo dock.launch verbose:=true`

    1. Should show a god’s eye view that looks as expected  
    
        ![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/2201238068-Screenshot_from_2019-09-19_09-59-33.png)
    
        

    
    
2. Switch to `sandisland_add_fog` branch which just adds fog to the sand island scene \([#!/osrf/vrx/commits/98149819c5d3f42ac87ba2f4e92cace4d61d53df?at=sandisland\_add\_fog](#!/osrf/vrx/commits/98149819c5d3f42ac87ba2f4e92cace4d61d53df?at=sandisland_add_fog)\)

    1. re-make and re-run and now the GUI view looks like this..  
    
        ![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/4042719981-Screenshot_from_2019-09-19_10-01-49.png)
    
        

    
    2. I also verified that this superposition of the symbols shows up  in the camera perspective  
    
        ![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/202421732-Screenshot_from_2019-09-19_10-10-39.png)
    

‌

For the purposes of the VRX competition we could use simpler dock models that don’t have all the placard symbols to see if that alleviates the problem.
